definition: to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He spoke darkly of possible future disaster .
sentences.chinese: 他悲观地说将来可能大难临头。

sentences.english: Here I am talkingtummy-rot about civilization, when your Tara's in danger.
sentences.chinese: 你的德园大难临头，我却还在讲什么关于文明的废话。

sentences.english: The possibility of being made redundant has been a sword of Damocles hanging over me for several months now.
sentences.chinese: 裁员的可能性好几个月来一直使我大难临头的危险。

sentences.english: I can understand why my uncle felt that trouble was coming to him here.
sentences.chinese: 我能理解伯父为何在这儿时总是觉得要大难临头了。

sentences.english: Many will doubtless be thrown into panic should a disaster strike.
sentences.chinese: 如有大难临头，很多人会惊慌失措。

sentences.english: A sense of impending doom came upon all of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有人都有一种大难临头的感觉。

definition: facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
to befall/to be imminent
great catastrophe
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
dangerous situation/venerable old age
to run into misfortune
lit. if the rabbit dies, the fox grieves (idiom); fig. to have sympathy with a like-minded person in distress
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
when things come to a head (idiom)
